case_description: Mr. Kumar underwent a gallbladder surgery at MetroCare Hospital. Post-operation, a surgical instrument was left inside his abdomen, requiring a second surgery. The hospital stated the incident was unintentional human error. Mr. Kumar filed a compensation claim under Consumer Protection Act, 2019.
legal_question: How is medical negligence established under Indian law, and what compensation can patients claim under Consumer Protection Act, 2019 for surgical errors?
